title: ANSIS Soil Domain Schema
description: Compound JSON Schema definitions of the complete list of entities, properties and vocabularies (enumerations).

Base.title: ANSIS JSON Base Schema
Base.description: Base properties and objects used to identify, type and link entities, bind them to schema, and otherwise describe objects from a system, rather than domain, perspective.
Base.$comment: Linked Data properties as per https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld.

$schema.title: JSON $schema
$schema.$comment: The JSON schema for the object. For use when "additionalProperties": false and therefore a property names $schema reference is a Bad Thing.

@id.title: JSON-LD Identifier
@id.description: An HTTP URI uniquely identifying the object as a Linked Data resource. Dereferencing the URI should, but may not, lead to a JSON or HTML representation of the resource.

@type.title: JSON-LD Type
@type.description: A compact URI uniquely identifying the type of the object according to the OWL/RDF domain model.

@context.title: JSON-LD Context
@context.description: A link to a JSON-LD Context document that maps property JSON keywords onto OWL/RDF definitions and namespaces (e.g. ansis) onto their base URI.

label.title: RDF Schema Label
label.description: A human-readable name for the object.

Entity_Link.title: ANSIS Entity Link
Entity_Link.description: A simple object supporting a link (e.g. a hyperlink) to another entity.

Objects.title: ANSIS JSON Objects
Objects.description: Reusable objects for structured property values - e.g. a QUDT quantity: a value/unit pair.

QuantityValue.title: QUDT QuantityValue
QuantityValue.description: A Quantity Value expresses the magnitude and kind of a quantity and is given by the product of a numerical value n and a unit of measure U. The number multiplying the unit is referred to as the numerical value of the quantity expressed in that unit.

QuantityValue_Observable.title: QUDT QuantityValue - Observable
QuantityValue_Observable.description: As per #QuantityValue with additional observation property keys.

ConceptValue.title: Concept Value
ConceptValue.description: A compact URI referencing an entry in an ANSIS vocabulary.

ConceptValue_Observable.title: Concept Value - Value
ConceptValue_Observable.description: A compact URI referencing an entry in an ANSIS vocabulary with additional observation property keys.

Entities.title: ANSIS Soil Domain Entity Schema
Entities.description: JSON Schema definitions of the complete list of entities (features in GIS speak) defined in or imported by the ANSIS Domain Ontology.

SoilSite.title: ANSIS Soil Site
SoilSite.description: A site where samples, observations, and treatments of soil are carried out.

SoilProfile.title: ANSIS Soil Profile
SoilProfile.description: A soil profile is a vertical section of a soil from the soil surface through all its horizons to parent material, other consolidated substrate material or selected depth in unconsolidated material.

SoilBody.title: ANSIS Soil Body
SoilBody.description: Part of the soil cover that is delineated at a scale useful for an application, and is homogeneous with regard to properties and/or spatial patterns.

Properties.title: ANSIS Soil Domain Property Schema
Properties.description: JSON Schema definitions of the complete list of properties defined in the ANSIS Domain Ontology. These definitions are referenced by objects in feature/entity schema and may be referenced by multiple objects - i.e. the scope (domain) of a property is not restricted to a single object (entity).

abundance.title: abundance
abundance.$comment: Requires conditional logical to support different vocabularies for different types.

agent.title: agent
agent.description: agent of geomorphological or biotic activity
agent.$comment: Requires conditional logical to support different vocabularies for different types.

aspect.title: aspect
aspect.description: direction or azimuth that a terrain surface faces

carbonateEffervescence.title: effervescence of carbonate
carbonateEffervescence.description: effervescence of carbonate in fine earth

chemistry.title: soil chemical property
chemistry.$comment: Abstract property - parent of other chemical properties

classification.title: has classification
classification.description: classification of the soil body or profile

classificationFamilyGravel.title: classification - Gravel of the surface and A1 horizon
classificationFamilyGravel.description: family criteria - Gravel of the surface and A1 horizon

continuity.title: continuity
continuity.description: continuity of linear or planar elements
continuity.$comment: Definition implies domain beyond pans - use conditional logic for enum $refs.

degree.title: degree or intensity
degree.description: degree or severity or intensity of phenomenon

density.title: density
density.description: mass per unit volume of a substance

depth.title: depth
depth.description: depth from local surface of entity

depthFreeWater.title: depth
depthFreeWater.description: Depth to free water at the site of soil observation, either above or below the soil surface, excluding litter and living vegetation. Positive values indicate water above the soil surface. Negative values indicate water below the soil surface.

depthGully.title: gully depth
depthGully.description: depth from local surface to the base of the gully

depthLower.title: lower depth
depthLower.description: depth from local surface to the base of the element

depthRHorizon.title: depth to R-Horizon
depthRHorizon.description: depth from local surface to the top of the R-Horizon

depthReason.title: reason for profile depth
depthReason.description: reason for the specific depth of this profile e.g. length of auger | depth of interest | rock | too wet â€¦

depthUpper.title: upper depth
depthUpper.description: depth from local surface to the top of the element

depthWidthRatio.title: depth width ratio
depthWidthRatio.description: depth to width ratio of entity; ratio of depth to width of the element
depthWidthRatio.$comment: qudt:QuantityValue in RDF - - simplified here as ratios are dimensionless

designSite.title: site design
designSite.description: overall design of sampling at the site e.g. ASLS|grid|transect

designSurvey.title: survey design
designSurvey.description: overall design of soil or landscape survey e.g. free|grid|stratified|miscellaneous

designation.title: horizon designation
designation.description: designation of soil horizon with the sequence composing the Profile or Soil Body

diameter.title: diameter
diameter.description: thickness or width of round object

distinctness.title: distinctness
distinctness.description: distinctness of boundary - in the context of a soil horizon, this refers to the distinctness of the lower boundary

drainage.title: drainage
drainage.$comment: example of a property bound to an enumeration

duration.title: duration
duration.description: temporal extent of event or phenomenon

elevation.title: elevation
elevation.description: elevation of element above a datum (usually MSL)

frequency.title: frequency
frequency.description: temporal frequency of event or phenomenon

grade.title: grade
grade.description: grade or degree of development of structure

grainSize.title: grain size
grainSize.description: size of the most common particles of a material

hasCoarseFragments.title: has coarse fragments
hasCoarseFragments.description: link to description of coarse fragments

hasLandCover.title: has land cover
hasLandCover.description: link to description of land cover

hasLandManagement.title: has land management
hasLandManagement.description: link to description of land management

hasLandSurface.title: has land surface
hasLandSurface.description: link to description of land surface

hasLandUse.title: has land use
hasLandUse.description: link to description of land use

hasLandformElement.title: has landform element
hasLandformElement.description: link to description of landform element

hasLandformPattern.title: has landform pattern
hasLandformPattern.description: link to description of landform pattern

hasMicrorelief.title: has microrelief
hasMicrorelief.description: link to description of microrelief at the site

hasMicrorelief_biotic.title: has microrelief - biotic
hasMicrorelief_biotic.description: link to description of biotic microrelief at the site

hasMicrorelief_gilgai.title: has microrelief - gilgai
hasMicrorelief_gilgai.description: link to description of gilgai microrelief at the site

hasMicrorelief_hummocky.title: has microrelief - hummocky
hasMicrorelief_hummocky.description: link to description of hummocky microrelief at the site

hasMicrorelief_other.title: has microrelief - other
hasMicrorelief_other.description: link to description of other microrelief at the site

hasMottles.title: has mottles
hasMottles.description: link to description of mottles and other colour patterns

hasOutcrop.title: has outcrop
hasOutcrop.description: link to description of rock outcrop at this entity

hasStreamChannel.title: has stream channel
hasStreamChannel.description: link to description of stream channel occurrence

mapSheet.title: mapSheet
mapSheet.description: map-sheet on which this location is found

material.title: material
material.description: material or composition of entity or element

methodElevation.title: elevation method
methodElevation.$comment: [ISSUE - discuss switching this to a vocab for usedProcedure]

methodSlope.title: slope method
methodSlope.$comment: [ISSUE - discuss switching this to a vocab for usedProcedure]

moistureStatus.title: moisture status
moistureStatus.description: moisture state of material while property evaluation is carried out

pattern.title: pattern
pattern.description: spatial pattern of channels or other linear element

permeability.title: permeability
permeability.description: rate of flow of liquid through the material

plasticity.title: plasticity
plasticity.description: capability of being formed or molded

porosity.title: porosity
porosity.description: proportion of void space in material

proportions.title: proportions
proportions.description: proportion of void space in material

purpose.title: purpose
purpose.description: purpose of or reason for activity

relatedActivity.title: related activity
relatedActivity.description: link to an activity related to this context

relatedHorizon.title: related soil horizon
relatedHorizon.description: related soil horizon within a soil body or sample, or associated with a contact

relatedLandSurveySite.title: related land survey site
relatedLandSurveySite.description: link to a land survey site related to this context

relatedLayer.title: related soil layer
relatedLayer.description: related soil layer within a soil body or profile

relatedProfile.title: Related Profile
relatedProfile.description: Link to a soil profile related to this context.

relatedProject.title: related project
relatedProject.description: link to project that supported this activity

relatedSample.title: related sample
relatedSample.description: link to a sample related to this context

relatedSite.title: related site
relatedSite.description: link to a soil site related to this context

relatedSoilBody.title: related soil body
relatedSoilBody.description: link to a soil body related to this context

relief.title: relief
relief.description: amount of vertical variation of the landform

shape.title: shape
shape.description: geometry of entity or entity boundary - in the context of a soil horizon, this refers to the shape of the lower boundary

size.title: size
size.description: geometric scale and extent of element

spacing.title: spacing
spacing.description: lateral separation of elements - in the context of substrate this refers to the spacing of discontinuities

structure.title: structure
structure.description: internal arrangement of elements of the material or entity

texture.title: texture
texture.description: material texture, in terms of particle size distribution and component materials

ansisType.title: type
ansisType.$comment: Renamed ansisType to avoid conflict with JSON schema standard keyword. [ISSUE] ObservableProperty?

underlyingMaterial.title: underlying material
underlyingMaterial.description: lithology of material underlying the landform

visitor.title: visitor
visitor.description: site visitor, for the purpose of sampling or observation

isSampleOf.title: is sample of
isSampleOf.$comment: Forcing a URI on assumption of a sensor registry somewhere else.

madeBySensor.title: Made by Sensor
madeBySensor.description: Relation between an Observation and the Sensor which made the Observations.
madeBySensor.$comment: Forcing a URI on assumption of a sensor registry somewhere else.

usedProcedure.title: Made by Sensor
usedProcedure.description: Relation between an Observation and the Sensor which made the Observations.
usedProcedure.$comment: Forcing a URI pointing to an ANSIS methods vocabulary {!!probably too restrictive!!}. No local enumeration as the list is too long.

phenomenonTime.title: Phenomenon Time
phenomenonTime.description: The time that the Result of an Observation, applies to the FeatureOfInterest. Not necessarily the same as the resultTime. May be an interval or an instant, or some other compound temporal entity [owl-time].

resultTime.title: Result Time
resultTime.description: The result time is the instant of time when the Observation activity was completed.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: A reference to the unit of measure of a quantity (variable or constant) of interest.
unit.$comment: Restricted to the QUDT vocabulary as a compact URI.

hasGeometry.title: Has Geometry
hasGeometry.description: The default geometry to be used in spatial calculations. It is Usually the most detailed geometry.

wktLiteral.title: WKT Literal
wktLiteral.description: A Well-known Text serialization of a geometry object.
wktLiteral.$comment: Will use the PostGIS EWKT (Extended Well-known Text) form for ANSIS. Restrict to GDA 2020 (EPSG:7844)?

Enumerations.title: ANSIS Soil Domain Enumerations
Enumerations.$comment: Enumerations defined according to the pattern recommended here: https://github.com/json-schema-org/json-schema-spec/issues/57

EntityTypes.title: ANSIS Entity Types
EntityTypes.$comment: Experimental - an enumeration to help JSON Schema aware clients display type names/labels as pop-ups, etc.

SoilWaterDrainage.title: Soil Water Drainage
SoilWaterDrainage.description: Drainage is a useful term to summarise local soil wetness conditions, that is, it provides a statement about soil and site drainage likely to occur in most years. It is affected by a number of attributes, both internal and external, that may act separately or together. Internal attributes include soil structure, texture, porosity, hydraulic conductivity, and water-holding capacity, while external attributes are source and quality of water, evapotranspiration, gradient and length of slope, and position in the landscape.
